projectPurpose: To automatically format Lua code to ensure a consistent and opinionated style, improving readability and maintainability across various Lua versions and dialects.
mainFeatures: Deterministic code formatting for multiple Lua variants (5.1-5.4, LuaJIT, Luau, CfxLua/FiveM)
Opinionated styling, inspired by Prettier and the Roblox Lua Style Guide
Parses and re-prints code for consistent style
Multiple installation methods (binaries, Cargo, GitHub Actions, pre-commit)

alternatives.name: Prettier (with prettier-plugin-lua)
mainFeatures: Opinionated code formatting for many languages
Integrates with editors, linters, and build systems
Focuses on consistent style by parsing and re-printing

alternatives.name: lua-fmt
mainFeatures: Aims for a single and consistent standard

alternatives.name: Online Lua Beautifiers/Formatters
mainFeatures: Format Lua code in a web browser

marketPositioning: StyLua is positioned as a dedicated, opinionated, and high-performance code formatter for the diverse Lua ecosystem. Its key strengths lie in its comprehensive support for a wide range of Lua versions and dialects, including those used in specific communities like Roblox (by following the Roblox Lua Style Guide). Being written in Rust likely contributes to its performance. It competes with general-purpose formatters like Prettier (via a plugin) and other Lua-specific formatters. StyLua differentiates itself through its explicit multi-dialect support and its opinionated approach tailored for Lua developers seeking a consistent and automated code style.
